CodeList.Name: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form Questionnaire Test Name

Description.TranslatedText: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form test name.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - Which of the following best describes your urinary control during the last 4 weeks?
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How would you describe the frequency of your erections during the last 4 weeks?

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: EPIC1-How Often Have You Leaked Urine
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: EPIC1-How Often Have You Leaked Urine
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - Over the past 4 weeks, how often have you leaked urine?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: EPIC-26 - How Often Have You Leaked Urine

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - Overall, how big a problem have your bowel habits been for you during the last 4 weeks?
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - Overall, how big a problem has your sexual function or lack of sexual function been for you during the last 4 weeks?
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - Overall, how big a problem has your urinary function been for you during the last 4 weeks?

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: EPIC1-Pads or Adult Diapers per Day
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: EPIC1-Pads or Adult Diapers per Day
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How many pads or adult diapers per day did you usually use to control leakage during the last 4 weeks?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: EPIC-26 - Pads or Adult Diapers per Day

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you? Abdominal/pelvic/rectal pain.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: EPIC-26 - Abdominal or Pelvic or Rectal Pain

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you during the last 4 weeks? Bleeding with urination.
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you? Bloody stools.
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem during the last 4 weeks, if any, has each of the following been for you? Breast tenderness/enlargement.
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem during the last 4 weeks, if any, has each of the following been for you? Change in body weight.
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you during the last 4 weeks? Dripping or leaking urine.
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem during the last 4 weeks, if any, has each of the following been for you? Feeling depressed.
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem during the last 4 weeks, if any, has each of the following been for you? Hot flashes.
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you? Increased frequency of bowel movements.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: EPIC-26 - Increased Frequency of Bowel Movements

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem during the last 4 weeks, if any, has each of the following been for you? Lack of energy.
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you? Losing control of your stools.
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you during the last 4 weeks? Need to urinate frequently during the day.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: EPIC-26 - Urinate Frequently During the Day

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you during the last 4 weeks? Pain or burning on urination.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: EPIC-26 - Pain or Burning on Urination

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you? Urgency to have a bowel movement.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: EPIC-26 - Urgency to Have a Bowel Movement

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How big a problem, if any, has each of the following been for you during the last 4 weeks? Weak urine stream or incomplete emptying.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: EPIC-26 - Weak Urine Stream or Incomplete Emptying

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How would you describe the usual quality of your erections during the last 4 weeks?
The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - Overall, how would you rate your ability to function sexually during the last 4 weeks?

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: EPIC1-Rate Ability to Have an Erection
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: EPIC1-Rate Ability to Have an Erection
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How would you rate each of the following during the last 4 weeks? Your ability to have an erection?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: EPIC-26 - Ability to Have an Erection

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form - How would you rate each of the following during the last 4 weeks? Your ability to reach orgasm (climax)?

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Short Form Questionnaire Test Name
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire EPIC-26 Test Name Terminology
